disk size: 939M

Boot failed: could not read the boot disk

No bootable device.
{code}

On the service image, you can see how its referring to the HTTP endpoint instead of the HTTPS endpoint of the cloud.  In addition, its not aware of the trusted root certificate of the domain that signed the certificate for the UFS.
{code}

fields.summary: ImportInstance failed to create booting instance on HTTPS-enabled Eucalyptus Cloud
fields.environment:
* Federated HTTPS-endpoint Setup
** Eucalyptus multi-cluster cloud with Eucalyptus DNS enabled - [hspencer-309|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint-4.2/309/]
** Eucalyptus cloud with Eucalyptus DNS enabled - [hspencer-352|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint-4.2/352/]

comments.body: [~hspencer], could you re-test this issue with the latest changes from [~sjones]?

[~sjones],

Actually, I have this set to false on both clouds:
{code}
[root@d-30 ~]# euctl bootstrap.webservices.default_https_enabled --region euca-admin@localhost
bootstrap.webservices.default_https_enabled = false

[root@c-31 ~]# euctl bootstrap.webservices.default_https_enabled --region euca-admin@localhost
bootstrap.webservices.default_https_enabled = false
{code}
From my understanding, this dealt with the eucarc file. 
{code}
# euctl bootstrap.webservices.default_https_enabled -s --region euca-admin@localhost
bootstrap.webservices.default_https_enabled = Default scheme prefix in eucarc.
{code}
Is this involved in some way with ImportInstance?
[~hspencer], I'm not clear what is meant by "HTTPS-enabled" (is it only a change of HTTPS certificate?)
[~sjones], UFS endpoints are HTTPS using a signed HTTPS cert.  Steps for setting up the clouds can be found here - QA-510.
[~hspencer], do you have a cloud that I use for debugging?

[~vasya],

Yes, please refer to the 'Environment' section of this ticket.  The federated environment is still running with HTTPS endpoints.

{code}
[root@c-31 ~]# euca-describe-regions --region euca-admin@
REGION	asap-rocky	https://ec2.g-22-07.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
REGION	rick-ross	https://ec2.d-36.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/
{code}

Looks like https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/tree/master/tools/imaging does not know how to download files over https :( The same library is used in the instance run path. Instance run works because download manifest ignores https cloud setting and provides URLs to parts with http prefix.
[~hspencer], were you able to verify that if euca-import-instance uses http endpoint the import works as expected?

I've verified that import tasks do work when using an http endpoint. 
I'm testing the ported CI test now: http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/nephoria-import-image-linux
The CI test is running with temporary default flags to disable userdata and force http endpoints to allow this test to run in the meantime. 
Thanks, 
-M
[~hspencer], [~mclark] do you have a set up where I can reproduce this issue?

Hi [~vasya], 
The following test can be run against any existing system. 
Just add the 'clc_ip' of the existing system and remove '--no-https' which is the default value of the extra_args job parameter before running. 
Removing the --no-https flag should be enough to reproduce. 
Thanks!, 
-M

http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8080/view/All/job/nephoria-import-image-linux/build?delay=0sec
